title: Isolation, Emptiness and Exile
main_text:
Even the Technology that promises to unite us, divides us. Each of usis now electronically connected to the globe, and yet we feel utterly alone. Dan Brown, Angel and Demons, Robert Langdon

The Lagoon by Joesph Conrad

Walking around by Pablo Neruda

An outpost of progress by Joseph Conrad

A farewell by Lord Alfred Tennyson

The War of the Worlds by H. G. Wells

Solitude by Byron

Simple Soul by Gustave Flaubert

Angel in the Grave by Edith Wharton
